name: Salmon or Tuna Tartare
description: I like to serve this on endive leaves, red pepper squares or rounds of cucumber. You also could top crostini with it. Don’t make it too far ahead of serving, because you don’t want the fish to cook in the lime juice and you won’t have the glistening color or flavor.
recipeYield: 2 1/2 cups, serving 10 as an hors d'oeuvre
keywords: albacore or salmon fillet, cucumber, salmon, appetizer, gluten-free, healthy
recipeIngredient: 1 pound center-cut albacore or salmon fillet, finely chopped
Lettuce or endive leaves for serving
cucumber rounds or toasted croutons for serving

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle the cucumber with salt, and let sit for 15 minutes while you prepare the remaining ingredients. Then rinse and drain on paper towels. Meanwhile, place the shallots in a bowl and cover with cold water. Let sit five minutes, then drain, rinse and drain again on paper towels.

In a medium bowl, toss the cucumber, fish, shallots, cilantro and capers with lime juice, rice vinegar and olive oil. Season with salt; if you want to add a little spice, add a pinch of cayenne. Taste and adjust seasonings. Chill until ready to serve (but not too long). Place spoonfuls on endive leaves, red pepper squares, cucumber rounds or croutons, and serve.
